data.title: Great food, lack luster service
data.text: Had the world Thai combination and spicy fried rice (skip the pineapple) and the combination C appetizer. Everything wss hot and served fast n fresh. Waitress was available but by no means friendly (language barrier?) Anyways menu was falling apart and our receipt was hand written on the back of someone else's. Tables were clean but go there to eat great food not be amazed by your surroundings. Avoid if on a first date.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service
data.text:
One of the best Thai Restaurants we have ever been to,

It is moderate priced and the portions are large and very flavorful!

We had the Spring Rolls and Tom Kha Kai Soup for an appatiser.  The Roll were crisp and not oily at all.  The soup was lighter and more citrus-y that other Thai places but I really likedthe difference.

We both had Panang Curry and it was some of the best we have had.

We highly recommend Thai World Restauranti

data.title: Great food and friendly service
data.text: I really enjoyed the yellow curry with Tofu. They also have brown rice which was great to have as an option. I went after a day of working in the area, but the comfortable atmosphere is somewhere I'd go on my own time as well.

data.title: Good Food but needs a makeover
data.text: The Thai food here is authentic and yummy but the decor is strange and feels dated. The one waitress who works there is often swamped and I think there must be just one person working in the back because it takes quite a while for the food to be made. It's well priced but you'd be better off going over to Silver Spoon if you want a better, faster experience.

data.title: Anniversary
data.text: Excellent food! Taste and portions are very good. Great discovery in Pembroke Pines. The curry is perfect and fast service.

data.title: Generous portions, reasonably priced and good food.
data.text:
I ordered take away Spicy fried rice, and asked for ekstra spicy. 
The food was very good! (I could only eat half, because the portions are BIG.)
Staff was smiling and friendly, excellent service.
Will come back here.

data.title: Really nice Thai food
data.text: We loved this restaurant. The food was really good, authenticThai, and the price was quite reasonable. They were really service-minded and fast :)

data.title: Family feel
data.text: Thai World has the best bar none thai food in south florida. The food is cooked to order by the owners and given great care to your tastes. Food is hot,tasty and always great. I have been coming here for 20 years and its always on point. They accommodate my health issues and need for lack of sugar and they make it happen. Just a pleasure to eat here.

data.title: Great Thai!!!
data.text: Great Thai, good price and the portions really reasonable I went here with my kids and they actually love it!!! Service 👎🏽 You have to ask for everything and I don't like that.

data.title: A Winner
data.text: I discovered Thai World by accident while my father was having work done on his car at a repair shop in the same shopping center, decided to try, and immediately became a big fan.  We go there every time I go to Florida to visit my father.  The food is excellent, the portions are generous, and the prices are quite reasonable.  The lunch specials are a great bargain.  Service has always been first-rate.  The first time we went there, the waitress noticed us arriving, with my father on a walker, and she came over to open the door for us - it's that kind of a place.  Highly recommended.

data.title: cooking dash
data.text:
only one waiter, server and maybe cook, its like shes doin everything. but she did it great. the food was excellent, serving size was great price commendable. definitely we will visit again!!! 

sheesh you might wanna check the ambiance a little bit hmmm, not that cozy and new, or maybe its just a thai setup :)

data.title: Great Thai food
data.text: This was my second time at this restaurant.First time there I ate at the restaurant .I had good service and good food.This time I ordered for take out.When I called ,I had a hard time understanding the person who answered the phone but then some one else talked to me .I ordered the spring rolls and an order of Massaman with chicken with medium "Heat" the order was on time.The spring rolls were ok but the Massaman was just right and a very large portion enough for two meals.One of the best I have had.No doubt I will return.

data.title: Soup Nazi
data.text:
after only 10 minutes in this restaurant I was convinced I would be leaving, for the first time since I can remember, without leaving a tip and giving it a 1 on my review.  After a brief wait, we were seated by a miserable man and drink orders taken.  When placing our orders with an equally miserable woman, I asked if salad could be substituted for soup, "no, soup and egg roll" she did not like this, and her face showed it.  I said "soup will be fine, please make sure it is hot."  Soup and egg roll arrive (which was about the size of my index finger).  Sour was not hot.  Getting her attention was most difficult.  When we were finally able to persuade her over, she snatched the soup, gave us a frightful look, and walked away.  The soup came back all but boiling.  Mid way thru lunch, my water glass was empty, and a friendly young lady approached out  table, filled my glass and took care of us for the rest of our meal, (hence the 3 star and a tip.) 

My guess is the first two we met were the owners and prefer to be back of house, but that is no excuse for the rudeness and terrible service.  Thai restaurants, as all restaurants, are a dime a dozen.  The food was ok, but did not compensated for service and rudeness.  I will not go back.

data.title: cook has changed
data.text: we go here more often than "Thai on the beach" and because of new cook... the food no longer is delicious...  we are vegetarians so other menu items may be just fine...

data.title: Home cooking
data.text: Authentic Thai food made by family that owns it. Been coming here for 20 years never gets old. Best kept secret

data.title: Wonderful food
data.text:
For me it's one of the best Thai restaurant!! The food is amazing!!! It's like comfort food!!! Yuuummmmmm
I recommend the tom kha kai, the pad Thai, the plates that's had curry!

data.title: Fantastic food, pleasant ambiance
data.text: Nothing gets my taste buds working than some fine Thai cuisine. This the the best place in Broward to get just that. The curry dishes can be spiced just as you want, the Tom Kha Kai soup is amazing, and your wallet won't be too badly invaded. You may have to loosen your belt, though, because the great food is served in generous portions. The restaurant is clean and the staff are attentive and friendly. Even the cook will come to your table to ask how you're enjoying your meal. Clearly one of the best restaurants in the area.

data.title: Feeling thai food in US!
data.text:
It was great experience to try thai restaurant here in america.We travelled from 7,000miles and we always explore the thai food worlds and these one fit in to out top 10!

The service-staff are amazingly great and naturally friendly,the food and the cost are all worth!

I strongly suggest these resraurant not just for travellers but even locals.You should experience thr same experience we had.

All the best!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Wonderfully surprised to find a great Thai restaurant right around the corner from home!  The shrimp and chicken red curry dinners were delicious as was the tom kha goong soup!  One of the best I have had as a matter of fact.  The aroma of curry from the booth next to us was so enticing we had to order the same thing - red curry.  The service was prompt and attentive and the meals were served hot.  The thai donuts were served fresh from the fryer and so hot we had to wait for them to cool off a bit before we could enjoy them.. Well worth the wait.  Will be back regularly.

data.title: Always good
data.text:
We may always count on some delicious Thai food with friendly servers at Thai World.

The usual Thai dishes are prepared very well.

Good for eating in, or taking out.
